abstract: The Federal Reserve Board on Tuesday said emergency conditions warranted its expedited action to approve Wells Fargo bid to acquire weakened banking rival Wachovia Corp..
lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve Board on Tuesday said emergency conditions warranted its expedited action to approve Wells Fargo bid to acquire weakened banking rival Wachovia Corp..

headline.main: Wells-Wachovia Deal Warranted Urgent Action, Fed Says

abstract: Wachovia’s record-setting loss comes as the bank tries to start cleaning up its mortgage mess after a deal with Wells Fargo.
snippet: Wachovia’s record-setting loss comes as the bank tries to start cleaning up its mortgage mess after a deal with Wells Fargo.
lead_paragraph: The Wachovia Corporation announced a $23.9 billion third-quarter loss on Wednesday as it prepared to be taken over by Wells Fargo.

headline.main: Wachovia Reports $23.9 Billion Loss for Third Quarter
headline.print_headline: Loss of $23.9 Billion Reported by Wachovia

abstract: Wachovia posts a big third quarter loss, California is seeing a glut of home sales and more Americans are skimping on prescription drugs.
snippet: Wachovia posts a big third quarter loss, California is seeing a glut of home sales and more Americans are skimping on prescription drugs.
lead_paragraph: While there have been signs this week that the icy credit markets are thawing, Wachovia provided a reminder that the nation’s banking troubles are far from over. The Charlotte, N.C.-based bank today reported the largest quarterly loss by any lender in the United States during the current financial crisis. Earlier this month, Wells Fargo agreed to buy Wachovia for $15.1 billion.
